title: 【投拆Hi】一人一信繼續投訴999，on L 9

replies.msg:
呢穫呢我就撐宗仔喇，你班狗又話人乜都入你地數，又話人地施政失誤燒埋你嗰疊。你收人工唔做嘢仲要阿頭嗰阿頭嗰阿頭代你道歉？知唔知醜呀。真係人唔笑⋯⋯

叫我地驚就唔好出街？！而家係留喺屋企打你個電話冇L用呀！

唔好話投拆冇L用呀，之前㩒爆999都冇人理，唔係連之後㩒個制投訴都懶呀？

之前召集大家俾條不生路何妖，唔係冇用㗎：

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PEn0fZau3G8&feature=share

仲有，入埋tg谷，第時有乜要投訴入去撳個制就得。你明啦，有時撥個輪想打個電話都會俾人cut線https://t.me/teethhavetiger


如果閣下真係懶西，但又想投訴嘅，不妨試試用https://complaint.typeform.com/to/TfsOo3

（不過呢，有巴打講過用以上方法gen出嚟嘅對家未必受理）


光復香港！

回帶：
https://lih.kg/1356599
https://lih.kg/1357606

週末入元朗，一跟感受鄉村氣息，一路寫投訴信，真係文青聽到都濕L晒啦

999 OnL9 投訴信如下：

To: Complaints Against Police Reporting Centre
enq@ipcc.gov.hk
ptr-c-iib@police.gov.hk
csp-c-iib@police.gov.hk
ssp-c-iib@police.gov.hk
ssp-capo@police.gov.hk
sp-hq-capo@police.gov.hk
[Date]
 
To Whom It May Concern,
 

Complaint on 999 Emergency Calls Service
 
I am writing to lodge a complaint agaisnt the inadequacy of the 999 Emergency Calls Service on 21st July 2019.
 
I made a call to the 999 Hotline around 9:10pm, 21st July 2019 to report suspected unlawful assembly in Fung Yau Street North Sitting-out Area, Yuen Long. My call was picked up by a female operator and I provided very detailed location and description of the situation: a large group of people dressed in white with red ribbons and sticks on their hands assembled around Fung Yau Street North Sitting-out Area; it caused me and my family much fear.
 
My complaints are as follows:
 
I requested a reference number for follow up. The operator brushed my request aside saying that they had already received a same report earlier. I was denied a reference number for follow up purpose;
 
My call was made around 9:10pm, 21st July 2019 and I was near the reported site for approximately another 10 minutes, outside Fung Kam Street Sports Centre. I refer to the Performance Pledge of Hong Kong Police Force: HKPF strives to respond to all genuine emergency 999 calls within an average response time of nine minutes in Hong Kong and Kowloon and 15 minutes in the New Territories. The response time is to be measured from the time a report is received at the Regional Command and Control Centre 999 console until police officers arrive at the scene.
 
No police appeared at the reported site at least up till 9:20pm. I later learned from online media that the police only showed up after 11:00pm around the reported site, i.e. the Yuen Long MTR Station. From 9.10pm to after 11.00pm is far beyond the promised average response time of 15 minutes.
 
My case was not handled seriously and timely. Consequently, the alleged perpetrators of violence had been allowed to assault innocent citizens in the Yuen Long MTR Station and the area nearby. I strongly believe that the crime was fully preventable had my report to the 999 Emergency Calls service centre been taken with the seriousness that it deserved.

I anticipate your responses to all of the following issues, please.
 
i.          Is there protocol to ensure that case reported are processed with a reference number which should be provided to the case reporter for follow up purpose;
ii.         What disciplinary actions would apply to  duty personnel who fails to abide by any such aforementioned protocol;
iii.        Are emergency calls made recorded and time-stamped? Under my rights stated in the Codes for Information Access, I would like to have this information as evidence of my genuine report to the 999 Emergency Calls service centre;
iv.        In case my demands for a report reference number and recording of my call made around 9:10pm, 21st July 2019, cannot be met, please advise me on how I can follow up on my case;
v.         Please provide the list of operators with their names and the UI numbers;
vi.        Please explain the severe delay of the response time after my report was made at around 9:10pm, 21st July 2019.
 
I would much appreciate your prompt response within two working days please. 
 
With concern and anticipation,
[Name]

已經唔信投訴有用
起碼你同堆@police.gov.hk投訴警務處肯定冇用
